newsitem.title: JAPAN: Honda March domestic output up 19% yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Honda March domestic output up 19% yr/yr.

text.p: Honda Motor Co Ltd said on Monday its domestic vehicle production, domestic sales, exports and overseas output in March rose as follows:
(with percentage comparisons from a year earlier)
Honda said domestic production rose in March for the ninth consecutive month on a year-on-year basis, helped mainly by higher exports.

Honda's domestic sales in March rose for the 27th successive month on a year-on-year basis, due to robust demand for its recreational vehicle series -- the Step Wagon, the S-MX and Odyssey, the new Logo compact hatchback and the Prelude sports car.
Exports rose for the seventh month in a row, helped by the start of shipments of the CR-V light sports-utility vehicle to North America in January this year.
Overseas production rose for the 14th consecutive month due to higher output in North America and Asia, the company said.

Honda also released data for the fiscal year ended March 31, 1997. The company's domestic vehicle production, exports, domestic sales and overseas output in fiscal 1996/97 were as follows (with percentage comparisons from a year earlier):
